result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Seville D Ashford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Seville D Ashford appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Seville D Ashford.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on State's Motion to Joinder with Sermonte Ashfords's cases 19CF4409 and 22CF1082.  Motion hearing held. Court hears argument. Court places findings on the record.  For reasons as set forth, Court GRANTS State's motion. Defense requested status date to determine case posture. For reasons stated on the record Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Parties selected Final PreTrial and Jury Trial Dates. Court ordered any motions filed by December 14, 2022. Case remains calendared in Reserve Branch.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Defense's Motion in opposition to State's Joinder Motion; Received and Filed.

Letter from the court to counsel - uploaded to the case and forwarded to counsel on today's date

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Seville D Ashford in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Seville D Ashford.  Prosecuting attorney Patricia Irene Daugherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Court granted defense request for time to review discovery and offer. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Seville D Ashford in court in person.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Seville D Ashford.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #12CF1604. Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa PD Officer B. Wade. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-13, this case has been reassigned to Judge Franke.

Defendant Seville D Ashford in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for status.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Thomas Harris
FOTP Defendant Writ
FOTP Defendant Writ

Defendant Seville D Ashford in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for status. SPD indicates that the defendant needs to be evaluated to determine eligibility. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V Lee hearing; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Signed. WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AD PROSEQUENDUM
Received and Signed. WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AD PROSEQUENDUM

Defendant Seville D Ashford not in court, defendant in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Mr Ashford is currently in Dodge County jail and needs to be evaluated to determine if he's eligible for SPD appointment of counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Signed.  WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AD PROSEQUENDUM
Received and Filed. WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AD PROSEQUENDUM
Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Seville D Ashford in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Return on Warrant. Arguments heard as to bail. Court re-instates $ 2,000.00 signature bond with other conditions. Case adjourned to Prelim Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,000.00 signature bond) LW
Received and Signed.  WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AD PROSEQUENDUM
Email correspondence with parties. Case scheduled for Return on Warrant on 05/19/2022, Br 16.
Letter from Federal Defender's office requesting further proceedings be held remotely.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Seville D Ashford not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Seville D Ashford in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Seville D Ashford in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Seville D Ashford appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case retabbed to Branch Grayson Branch 16 due to Co-Defendant.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
